trans-unit.source: Restoring a database from a backup copy

seg-source.mrk: Restoring a database from a backup copy

target.mrk: Restoring a database from a backup copy

trans-unit.source: To restore a database by using a full backup from a specified location, specify the restoreFrom=path attribute in the boot-time connection URL.

seg-source.mrk: To restore a database by using a full backup from a specified location, specify the restoreFrom=path attribute in the boot-time connection URL.

target.mrk: To restore a database by using a full backup from a specified location, specify the restoreFrom=path attribute in the boot-time connection URL.

trans-unit.source: If a database with the same name exists in the <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> location, the system will delete the database, copy it from the backup location, and then restart it.

seg-source.mrk: If a database with the same name exists in the <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> location, the system will delete the database, copy it from the backup location, and then restart it.

target.mrk: If a database with the same name exists in the <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> location, the system will delete the database, copy it from the backup location, and then restart it.

trans-unit.source: The log files are copied to the same location they were in when the backup was taken. You can use the logDevice attribute in conjunction with the restoreFrom=path attribute to store logs in a different location.

seg-source.mrk: The log files are copied to the same location they were in when the backup was taken.
You can use the logDevice attribute in conjunction with the restoreFrom=path attribute to store logs in a different location.

target.mrk: The log files are copied to the same location they were in when the backup was taken.
You can use the logDevice attribute in conjunction with the restoreFrom=path attribute to store logs in a different location.

trans-unit.source: For example, to restore the sample database by using a backup copy in <codeph>c:\mybackups\sample</codeph>, the connection URL should be:

seg-source.mrk: For example, to restore the sample database by using a backup copy in <codeph>c:\mybackups\sample</codeph>, the connection URL should be:

target.mrk: For example, to restore the sample database by using a backup copy in <codeph>c:\mybackups\sample</codeph>, the connection URL should be:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see "restoreFrom=path attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information, see "restoreFrom=path attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information, see "restoreFrom=path attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.
